com.pi4j.component.adafruithat

Class AdafruitServo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pi4j.component.adafruithat.AdafruitServo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.pi4j.component.Component, com.pi4j.component.servo.Servo

    public class AdafruitServo
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.pi4j.component.servo.Servo
    This java class commands a servo wired to the "Adafruit Servo HAT" developed for the Raspberry Pi.

    See ServoHAT

    The AdafruitServo class controls the servo position and movement. A class needs to be instantiated for each servo. Servo names range from "S01" for pin set 0 (labeled on the HAT) through "S16" for pin set 15.

    Up to 16 servos can be commanded on a single HAT. Each has its own independent control but all must have the same PWM operating frequency (50Hz default)

    The fully-dedicated PCA9685 PWM driver chip controls servo position. The chip is commanded through the I2C interface. Only two pins (SDA and SCL) are required to drive the multiple servos, and since it's I2C you can also connect any other I2C devices or HAT to the same pins.

    This means up to 32 Adafruit Servo HATs can be stacked to control up to 512 servos. The default I2C address for a HAT is 0x40 but can be modified on the HAT with solder connections to alter its I2C device address.

    Author:
    Eric Eliason

      • setPulseWidth

        public void setPulseWidth(float pulseWidth)
        Set the pulse width (milliseconds) to drive servo position.
        Parameters:
        pulseWidth - in milliseconds

      • setOperatingLimits

        public void setOperatingLimits(float minimumPulseWidth,
                               float neutralPulseWidth,
                               float maximumPulseWidth)
        Set the operating pulse width range for the servo. Consult the servo's data sheet for the manufacturer's recommended pulse width designation.
        Parameters:
        minimumPulseWidth - minimum-position pulse width in milliseconds
        neutralPulseWidth - neutral-position pulse width in milliseconds
        maximumPulseWidth - maximum-position pulse width in milliseconds

      • setPositionRange

        public void setPositionRange(float minimumX,
                             float maximumX)
        Specify the relative minimum and maximum value range of the servo motor. The value passed to the setPostion() method must be in this range. The minimumX value corresponds to the servo position of minimum pulse width and maximumX to the servo position of the maximum pulse width.
        Parameters:
        minimumX - Defaults to 0.0
        maximumX - Defaults to 1.0

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(float servoPosition)
        Move servo to relative position.
        Specified by:
        setPosition in interface com.pi4j.component.servo.Servo
        Parameters:
        servoPosition - The range of the servoPosition corresponds to the minimum and maximum values set in the setPositionRange() method. The default range is 0.0 to 1.0 if the setPositionRange() method is not called.

        public float getPwmFreq()
